properties.abstract: When climbing Ofenhoren in the Gelmer area, one hikes a considerable part of the route on scree and in boulder fields, but the effort pays off. Mighty jagged rocks tower left and right of the route, red amphibolite lets Ofenhoren shine as if on fire, and summiteers enjoy a vertiginous view to the Guttannen village 2000 metres down below. The alluvial plain Obrist Diechter, one of the gems of the Grimsel area, is a destination in its own right. From there Ofenhoren can already be seen, and it is hard to believe that it is so easy to climb.
properties.subtitle: In red rocks above Grimsel granite
properties.title: From Gelmersee

sac_photos.title: The lovely alluvial plain Obrist Diechter full of cotton grass
The ascent is on the reddish rock basin left of the Ofenhoren summit.
